alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 4:08PM MST until February 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches late tonight through the day Monday, with an additional 4 to 6 inches possible Monday evening through the day Tuesday. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...In South Dakota, Marshall and Roberts Counties. In Minnesota, Traverse and Big Stone Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Minnesota, the latest road conditions can be obtained at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1. In South Dakota, the latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
